intro: Menodora helianthemoides var. engelmannii, commonly known as Engelmann's helianthemoid daisy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family, and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for study in arid and semi-arid ecosystems.
